1.text: Woe to her that is rebellious and corrupted, to the oppressing city!

2.text: She hearkened not to the voice; she received not correction; she confided not in Jehovah; she drew not near her God.

3.text: Her princes in the midst of her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves, that leave nothing for the morning.

4.text: Her prophets are vain-glorious, treacherous persons; her priests profane the sanctuary, they do violence to the law.

5.text: The righteous Jehovah is in the midst of her: he doeth no wrong. Every morning doth he bring his judgment to light; it faileth not: but the unrighteous knoweth no shame.

6.text: I have cut off nations: their battlements are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by; their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, so that there is no inhabitant.

7.text: I said, Only fear me, receive correction; so her dwelling shall not be cut off, howsoever I may punish her. But they rose early, they corrupted all their doings.

8.text: Therefore wait ye for me, saith Jehovah, until the day that I rise up to the prey; for my determination is to assemble the nations, that I may gather the kingdoms together, to pour upon them mine indignation,â€”all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

9.text: For then will I turn to the peoples a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of Jehovah, to serve him with one consent.

10.text: From beyond the rivers of Cush my suppliants, the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine oblation.

11.text: In that day thou shalt not be ashamed for all thy doings wherein thou hast transgressed against me; for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that exult in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.

12.text: And I will leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of Jehovah.

13.text: The remnant of Israel shall not work unrighteousness, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: but they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

14.text: Exult, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; rejoice and be glad with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem:

15.text: Jehovah hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy; the King of Israel, Jehovah, is in the midst of thee; thou shalt not see evil any more.

16.text: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear not; Zion, let not thy hands be slack.

17.text: Jehovah thy God is in thy midst, a mighty one that will save: he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love; he will exult over thee with singing.

18.text: I will gather them that sorrow for the solemn assemblies, who were of thee: the reproach of it was a burden [unto them].

19.text: Behold, at that time I will deal with all them that afflict thee; and I will save her that halted, and gather her that was driven out; and I will make them a praise and a name in all the lands where they have been put to shame.

20.text: At that time will I bring you, yea, at the time that I gather you; for I will make you a name and a praise, among all the peoples of the earth, when I shall turn again your captivity before your eyes, saith Jehovah.
